alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 8:51PM CDT until May 10 at 4:41PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the Arkansas River and up into the Fourche LaFave begin to flood. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 24.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 24.9 feet Thursday afternoon. It will then fall to 24.5 feet and begin rising again Friday evening. It will rise above flood stage Saturday morning and continue to rise to 27.2 feet early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 24.5 Wed 7 PM 24.8 24.5 25.7 27.2 1 PM 5/08 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
